DOC.brief_summary: Bone health significant public health issue United States . An estimated 10 million Americans age 50 old living osteoporosis , approximately 50 % woman 25 % men age 50 experience osteoporosis-related fracture remain lifetime . Recent research advancement produce effective measure improve maintain bone health , include exercise , diet , screen test , pharmacotherapies , fall prevention strategy . These finding , however , fully incorporate daily life adult , many unaware magnitude bone-health problem . Thus , great effort must make effectively disseminate evidence-based research finding improve bone health behavior public . The Internet , increase popularity , effective tool endeavor . Despite great deal available online health resource , lack research investigate effective method package deliver resource yield positive public health outcome . Expanding upon prior finding use innovative approach combine two model social cognitive theory ( SCT ) RE-AIM framework ( Reach , Effectiveness , Adoption , Implementation , Maintenance ) , proposal , propose large scale online study ( N = 866 ) compare long-term impact two SCT-based online bone health intervention adults age 50 old target two large online community . The two intervention ( 1 ) 8-week SCT-based Online Bone Health ( TO-BoneHealth ) program ( 2 ) 12-month TO-BoneHealth Plus program , include TO-BoneHealth program follow biweekly theory-based eNewsletters follow-up individual 's bone health behavior ( `` booster '' intervention ) 10 month . The intervention ' impact assess follow modify RE-AIM framework : ( ) Effectiveness ( knowledge , select bone health behavior , fall incidence , initiation discussion bone health primary care provider , eHealth literacy ) ; ( b ) Reach ( number participant program reach ) ; ( c ) Implementation ( program usage ) ; ( ) Maintenance ( participant ' bone health behavior maintenance ) . With rapid growth online community , finding study significantly contribute current eHealth practice research serve dissemination model health promotion project target online community .
